description.narrative: The overall purpose of the program is to help to build the foundation for long-term reconstruction, economic rehabilitation, and the reestablishment of state administration throughout the country. The specific objectives of the EMRP 2 are to assist the government to: (a) facilitate agricultural marketing in specific areas with high agricultural potential that have been affected by the conflict, (b) reconstruct and rehabilitate critical infrastructure, and (c) strengthen capacity of participating ministries and agencies for improved governance and transparency and of local governments for future decentralization. These objectives build on the objectives and activities of EMRP 1 and are consistent with the ECP and the PPMRRP.

condition.narrative: Recipient shall, not later than 30 days after effectiveness, enter into a MoU w/Line Ministries and Agencies allocatingresponsibilities for project implementation, provision of TA, and M&E.
The Recipient shall, not later than 6 months after effectiveness, adopt and maintain and environmental and social mitigationsystemfor the implementation of the project
The recipient shall monitor and evaluate progress of the project and prepare project reports, covering the period of 1 calendarquarter, and submit to IDA one month after the end of such period.
The recipient shall provide not later than January 31 of each year during project implementation, an Annual Action plan forapproval.
The recipient will carry out the project in accordance with a Project Operational Manual.
The recipient will maintain a Steering committee and a PMIU satisfactory to IDA at all times during project implementation.

comment.narrative: Target to be reassessed as part of restructuring.

title.narrative: Kilometers of water network in Malanje and N'Dalantando rehabilitated

target.value: 50 km rehabilitated in Malanje and 35 rehabilitated in N'Dalantando

comment.narrative: Target to be reassessed as part of restructuring.
Target to be reassessed as part of restructuring.

title.narrative: Number of people in N'Dalantando with access to improved water services through house connections and rehabilitated standpipes rises

comment.narrative: All house connections were completed as of March 2011. To be updated on next sequence.

title.narrative: Number of people in Malange with access to improved water services through house connections and rehabilitated standpipes rises
New piped household water connections that are resulting from the project intervention

comment.narrative: 1632 as of March 2011. Will be updated next sequence.

title.narrative: Improved community water points constructed or rehabilitated under the project

comment.narrative: Feeder roads- Contracts were signed in July 2012 and implementation started in September 1, 2012. Target will be reassessed aspart of restructuring.
The rehabilitations is completed (as of 3/2011). The Borrower did with its own resources.

title.narrative: Number of people in urban areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project

comment.narrative: Estimated from house connections and standpipes constructed
The value refers only to N'Dalatando

title.narrative: Kilometers in good condition for targeted roads in selected provinces

baseline.value: All selected roads are in poor condition (0km)

target.value: All selected roads are in good condition (600km)

comment.narrative: Due to the change of unit cost, only 200 km of road, in the province of Bie, will be rehabilitated. Contracts were signed in July2012 and implementation starts on September 1, 2012.

title.narrative: Capacity of Ministry of Energy and Water to carry out public expenditure tracking studies improved

comment.narrative: Will be included in next sequence.

title.narrative: Ministries involved produce sector strategies acceptable to IDA

comment.narrative: Water and power sectors have begun preparing policies. Transport sector has begun discussions.

title.narrative: Medium and low-voltage distribution systems in N'Dalantando, Uige, Malanje, Luena, Kuito, and Luanda rehabilitated and operating

baseline.value: Only about half of installed capacity is operational.

target.value: Rehabilitation complete and services operating continuously.

comment.narrative: Contract awarded and civil works started.

title.narrative: Systems of procurement and financial management in the ministries and agencies involved in the project, according to the World Bankassessment

baseline.value: Procurement risk assessment shows risk to be high

target.value: Procurement risk assessment shows risk to have declined
